  • havoc.autoval.tests.system_fw_update.system_fw_update

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.system_fw_update.system_fw_update

from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function, unicode_literals

import time

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.result_handler import ResultHandler
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.fw_update_util import FwUpdateUtil



[docs]class FwUpdateTest(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(FwUpdateTest, self).__init__()
        self.cfg_filter = []



[docs]    def setup(self):
        super(FwUpdateTest, self).setup(inband_config_check=False)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        """
        The test performs firmwre upgrade/downgrade and toggle between the
        'latest' and 'previous' know firmware versions (by default) to the
         no of times specified.

        If upgrade_to is provided as input then firmware is upgraded to
        specified firmwre. If downgrade_to downgraded to specified firmware.
        By default firmware upgrade's/downgrade's to latest and previous.

        If the specific latest/previous firmware version is provided as test
        input then test update or downgrade to the specific version.

        The firmware upgrade should take place in following order.
            1st: BMC
            2nd: BIC
            3rd: CPLD
            4th: UEFI
        """
        self.update_type = None
        cycle = self.test_control.get("cycle", 1)
        for fw_type in self.test_control:
            # Skip any keys like run_id etc havoc added by default.
            if type(self.test_control[fw_type]) is not dict:
                continue
            update_method = self.test_control[fw_type].get("method", None)
            fw_to_upgrade = self.test_control[fw_type].get("upgrade_to", None)
            fw_to_downgrade = self.test_control[fw_type].get(
                "downgrade_to", None
            )
            _cycle = self.test_control[fw_type].get("cycle", None)
            if _cycle is not None:
                cycle = _cycle
            # Downgrade only case
            if fw_to_downgrade and cycle < 2:
                bool_swap_fw = True
            else:
                bool_swap_fw = False
            if not fw_to_downgrade:
                fw_to_downgrade = "previous"
            if not fw_to_upgrade:
                fw_to_upgrade = "latest"
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "Running %s %s firmware update" % (fw_type, update_method)
            )
            for _iter in range(cycle):
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Running cycle - %d" % _iter)
                if bool_swap_fw:
                    update_to = fw_to_downgrade
                    bool_swap_fw = False
                else:
                    update_to = fw_to_upgrade
                    bool_swap_fw = True
                if "bios" in fw_type.lower():
                    FwUpdateUtil.bios_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        self.test_control,
                        update_to,
                    )
                elif "openbmc" in fw_type.lower():
                    FwUpdateUtil.openbmc_fw_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        self.test_control,
                        update_to
                    )
                elif fw_type.lower() in ("bic", "gpv2-bic"):
                    FwUpdateUtil.bic_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        fw_type.lower(),
                        update_to
                    )
                elif fw_type.lower() in ("bicbl", "gpv2-bicbl"):
                    FwUpdateUtil.bicbl_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        fw_type.lower(),
                        update_to
                    )
                elif fw_type.lower() in ("cpld", "gpv2-cpld"):
                    FwUpdateUtil.cpld_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        fw_type.lower(),
                        update_to
                    )
                elif fw_type.lower() == "pcie_sw":
                    FwUpdateUtil.pciesw_update(
                        self.host,
                        update_method,
                        _iter,
                        fw_type.lower(),
                        update_to
                    )
                else:
                    raise TestError(
                        "Unsupported %s firmware upgrade found " % fw_type
                    )
            # Revert back the cycle count for other firmwares.
            cycle = self.test_control.get("cycle", 1)
            test_matrix = FwUpdateUtil.get_test_matrix()
            result_handler = ResultHandler()
            result_handler.update_test_results(test_matrix)
            self.cfg_filter.extend(
                FwUpdateUtil.get_cfg_check_filter_list(fw_type.lower())
            )
            # Deleting the fw folder within the timestamp folder after each
            # fw-test type
            self._try_cleanup_dirs(fw_type.lower())



[docs]    def cleanup(self):

        super(FwUpdateTest, self).cleanup(
            cfg_filter=set(self.cfg_filter),
            inband_config_check=False,
            config_check=True,
            config_data=None
        )
        self._try_cleanup_dirs()


    def _try_cleanup_dirs(self, fw_type=None):
        try:
            # Deleting the timestamp folder i.e., Folder created on the BMC
            FwUpdateUtil.check_and_delete_directory_contents(self.host, fw_type)
        except Exception:
            # This might fail on some systems that don't have BMC access, don't
            # fail the test because of it
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Failed to delete folder on BMC")




[docs]def main():
    test = FwUpdateTest()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
